pull.title: refactor: Add missing includes to fix gcc-13 compile error
pull.body:
On current master:

```
  CXX      support/libbitcoin_util_a-lockedpool.o
support/lockedpool.cpp: In member function â€˜void Arena::free(void*)â€™:
support/lockedpool.cpp:99:20: error: â€˜runtime_errorâ€™ is not a member of â€˜stdâ€™
   99 |         throw std::runtime_error("Arena: invalid or double free");
      |                    ^~~~~~~~~~~~~
support/lockedpool.cpp:22:1: note: â€˜std::runtime_errorâ€™ is defined in header â€˜<stdexcept>â€™; did you forget to â€˜#include <stdexcept>â€™?
   21 | #include <algorithm>
  +++ |+#include <stdexcept>
   22 | #ifdef ARENA_DEBUG
support/lockedpool.cpp: In member function â€˜void LockedPool::free(void*)â€™:
support/lockedpool.cpp:320:16: error: â€˜runtime_errorâ€™ is not a member of â€˜stdâ€™
  320 |     throw std::runtime_error("LockedPool: invalid address not pointing to any arena");
      |                ^~~~~~~~~~~~~
support/lockedpool.cpp:320:16: note: â€˜std::runtime_errorâ€™ is defined in header â€˜<stdexcept>â€™; did you forget to â€˜#include <stdexcept>â€™?

events.message: Add missing includes to fix gcc-13 compile error

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [hebasto](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26924#pullrequestreview-1262567633), [fanquake](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26924#pullrequestreview-1263285790) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ðŸ‘Ž to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.

ACK fadeb6b103cb441e0e91ef506ef29febabb10715.

While touching headers, the unused `#include <config/bitcoin-config.h>` can be removed as well.

And IWYU suggests to drop `#include <limits.h>`. But there could be some platform-specific pitfalls. FWIW, on my machine, the `limits.h` does not contain `#define PAGESIZE`.

ACK fadeb6b103cb441e0e91ef506ef29febabb10715 - tested this fixes compilation with GCC 13. I don't think theres a need to do anything else here, and that'd also just potentially complicate backporting.

> While touching headers, the unused #include <config/bitcoin-config.h> can be removed as well.

sgtm.

However, I wonder if we should require for preprocessor stuff that is used in `#ifdef` or `#if` to be mentioned in after the include. Otherwise, removing an include can result in a passing but broken build.

For example:

```cpp
#include <config/bitcoin-config.h> // for FEATURE_FOO
